meanings.definition: The quality or state of being owlish.
meanings.sent1: Her owlishnesses was evident in the way she blinked slowly and observed everything around her.
meanings.sent2: The owlishnesses of the professor was apparent in his wise and thoughtful demeanor.
meanings.sent3: The owlishnesses of the librarian made her the perfect candidate to organize the book club.
meanings.sent4: His owlishnesses during the meeting was like a beacon of wisdom in a sea of confusion.
meanings.sent5: The owlishnesses of the old owl in the tree made it seem like a guardian of the forest.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of resembling an owl in appearance or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The child's owlishnesses was adorable as she hooted and flapped her arms like wings.
meanings.sent2: His owlishnesses was uncanny, with his round glasses and habit of staying up late.
meanings.sent3: The owlishnesses of the costume party was a hoot, with everyone dressed as different owls.
meanings.sent4: Her owlishnesses at night was like a silent guardian watching over the house.
meanings.sent5: The owlishnesses of the painting captured the essence of the wise bird in all its glory.
